text: hey everybody Thomas Joseph here we all
like to save money right well here is a
fast and easy way to do it
buying a whole chicken in your grocery
store and cutting it up into eight
pieces yourself is really simple to do
and it will end up saving you money and
with practice you should be able to do
this in about a minute I have my chicken
here on a cutting board the drumsticks
are facing me because that's what I'm
going to start with first so all you
need is a chef's knife and a pair of
scissors to do this and a cutting board
that is big enough to accommodate
butchering the chicken so here we go
starting with the drumsticks slice the
skin you can see the joint pop-up cut
right in between the joint I'm popping
the joint cutting right through turn the
chicken on the side cut off the wings
make a small cut on each side of the
wing and you should be able to pop the
wing out and you repeat the process over
on this side now you use scissors to cut
down the backbone we're not counting the
backbone as one of the eight pieces but
what you should do is just throw this
into a resealable plastic bag and throw
it in your freezer for whenever you're
making chicken stock and then you cut
right through the breastbone
and there you go one last piece you're
going to cut the drumstick and the thigh
in half right behind the line of fat
closest to the drumstick and you should
be able to glide your knife right in
between the two joints so there you have
it in about a minute you have eight
pieces of chicken that you can cook with
whatever recipe you'd like you have a
backbone for stock and you have a little
extra cash in your pocket so kitchen
conundrum for you solved if you have any
kitchen conundrums that you need solved
write in the comments section below or
reach out to us using the hashtag
kitchen conundrums and we will solve
whatever kitchen problems you may have
you
you
